abstract: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: The British inhabitants of a remote island in the South Atlantic were looking forward to their first shipment of messages and supplies from their homeland for a decade in September 1916.
snippet: From the archives of the International Herald Tribune: The British inhabitants of a remote island in the South Atlantic were looking forward to their first shipment of messages and supplies from their homeland for a decade in September 1916....

headline.main: 1916: Tristan Da Cunha to Receive Mail
